paper_abstract: In the post-genomic era, predicting protein function is a challenging problem. It is difficult and burdensome work to unravel the functions of a protein by wet experiments only. In this paper, we propose a novel method to predict protein functions by building a "Protein Interaction Network Dictionary (PIND)". This method deduces the protein functions by searching the most similar "words"(an anagram of functions in neighbor proteins on a protein-protein interaction graph) using global alignments. An evaluation of sensitivity and specificity shows that this PIND approach outperforms previous approaches such as Majority Rule and Chi-Square measure, and that it competes with the recently introduced Random Markov Model approach.
paper_title: Computational method for protein function prediction by constructing protein interaction network dictionary
